title: Can we get a stealth based support?
body:
One who helps people escape, disappear, deflect attacks, gathers intel, and destroys enemy wards and traps? AND ISNT CENTERED AROUND HEALING OR SHIELDING

I repeat NO HEALS AND NO SHIELDS on this support

replies.body: Stealth based characters are so hard to balance and if you have them based on doing things that arent traditional support role things then you are gonna have some really unbalanced shit.

I think thats because every stealth champion is also designed to burst champions down but a stealth support wont do that so long as their damage ratios look like rakkan's . 

im all for an new support that isn't a heal or shield bot but, i dont mind things like rakkan passive shield and eve passive hp regen to a specific %

Yeah, the stealth-based support won't burst people down, the person they're supporting will.  And that's what's going to make them so hard to balance.  The only stealth most champs have is brush, and they're balanced around that.  Throw in the ability for _anyone_ to have stealth _anywhere_, and you're talking seriously broken.  Now, if instead they granted camouflage (like Twitch's Q does) and had a way to essentially pull people out of combat, that _might_ work in terms of balance, but I doubt it would be very popular.

camo is good.  i recently played dota 2, in it there is a hero named phantom assassin. she has a skill that among other things makes her not show up on the mini map to the enemy team. i feel like is would be a cool thing for a league champion especially a support going on dangerous warding adventures in enemy territory. this way they could ward and roam safely but there is nothing from preventing a champion from spotting them and engaging them so long as their camera is on that champion.

Nice icon btw.

I actually rather like that idea overall.  Maybe another Vastaya from the jungle like Nidalee, except they're based on a prey animal instead of a predator?  Have their passive keep them from showing up on the minimap except when in combat, give them a couple of tools to support an ally and benefit from it themself (perhaps base it around a mutualistic symbiotic theme?) and an uber-disengage for an ult.  I would definitely buy and play someone like that.

Although I'm ten thousand percent against adding any more Stealth to league (in fact, as far as I'm concerned the only ones who should have it are {{champion:28}} and {{champion:17}}, this does actually get my gears turning...

**What if, instead of going for a stealth champion, we went for an espionage/trap based champion?**

Think about it.

* Faster movement while not seen by opponents, similar to Evelynn, but applies as soon as you enter UNWARDED brush like Nidalee.
* Sweeper sort of skill on an ability, for finding traps and enemy wards.
* Hack ability, to re-program an enemy trap or ward to work for the other team.
* Steal ability, to steal an enemy (or ally) trap/ward and place in another location.
* Own trap ability, or even make the ^steal^ ability place his/her own traps if a suitable ward/trap is not found at the location.
* And an ultimate. Something like an EMP AoE Silence around himself/herself would work fine. Or even like a global/long range Thresh lantern. He/She ults a spot on the map, and appears there, and can grab his/her ally and forcibly remove them from the area, bringing them back to the initial cast zone. Only one ally per trip.
* And finally, make it a male character with a female voice actress with the /joke of "Traps aren't Gay!"

Done and done.

So most champs kits are tied into the character itself (kindred hunts souls so her passive, fiddle is a scarecrow he has a fear,etc.) So im thinking this champ is like a guardian angel seen only to the one it protects kind of like angels in the outfield(and for gameplay purposes seen by allies) Im thinking the passive has to do with binding to the champ of your choice like kalista it would also be a double passive that grants an aura the aura is visible to enemies because counterplay, so they can see when you are near and when u are near the aura grants something cool.

So supps do(or rather should) a fair amount of warding so obviously a supp champ should have a kit that allows them to stealthily place wards in places other champs wouldn't be able to I suggest a toggle stealth not activated like shaco or twitch and not proximity based like twitch or eve but again our champ doesn't deal damage. The counterplay to this stealth we can make a number of things but for the purpose of my vision I want it to be toggle and Id say counterplay would be slowed movement speed and in this form You cannot attack enemies at all and upon leaving this form enemies are granted vision of you and you still cant use abilities for an amount of time after leaving stealth(either that or less complicated we can make the mana cost per second rlly high)

Now I know op said no heals or shields and I even said we dont wasnt an invisible soroka in lane but Im gnna bend that here because a champ wth no dmg. heals, or shields doesn't have many avenues,

I have to go but I'll maybe pick this idea up when i return please join me in brainstorming this stealthy support's kit.

As a former support main, I can tell you that some form of shielding OR healing is essential to supporting a team. Stealth would be something new, but it still needs some sort of traditional support potential to be effective. If it didn't you'd end up with a champ that can't support as well as other champions like Thresh, Janna, Leona, or even Nautilus. The reason Nautilus and Leona are effective without a heal or shield for their team is because they have too much cc and tankiness to not pay attention to. If this champion doesn't have tankiness and cc then all you need to do is blow them up and the enemy adc is short a support and they don't have the stealth advantage anymore. If the champion has too much stealth and no heal or shield then they become an assassin without enough damage. If they have not enough stealth and a shield or heal then the stealth becomes a useless gimmick. 
Don't get me wrong it's a good idea and it can be done, but it needs to have the characteristic traits of a support as well, and they need to balance the stealth and heal/shield in order to be useful without being broken.
